channel.title: Comments for page "Making the Trade"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Making the Trade"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I'm usually a stickler for grammar, but I think we meant "fickle"

The most basic method is to get enough friend points so that you are almost hanging out with both of them, then spend a day getting as many friend points as possible. This method needs the least preparation, but the chance of success is somewhat f*ckle

lol. something so small and probably overlooked several hundred times

item.title: no anon with hard bingoes
item.content:encoded:
Getting Anonymous is a bit more difficult. You need to be the victim of a note page assisted bingo.

must be a note soft bingo to get anon, does not work with a note hard bingo.
adding a warning, or changing the text acordingly would be nice.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: LisaLisa 2 has always had Turn the Page, and Saving Grace is a White Eye exclusive jutsu.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
LisaLisa seems to have swapped out Saving Grace for a new jitsu:

Turn the Page
XP: 150000
+1 Range, Change Teams without using up a Team Change - Note Page needed
0 C

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: According to her article, you CAN use FoA and friend points, but not anything else.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: is it a MUST to hangout via FP to get Lisalisa??FoA cannot?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Great, thanks Fax. Added to +30 stamina part to the end of the guide and to the Bloodlines page.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I don't know the chakra cost on Saving Grace, but you CAN get the Note as a Chunin, and the name is, AFAIK, still "Note Rush".

And Tote bingoes get +30 stamina.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Updated quite a few things for the guide, but want some checks on information I added.

What's the Chakra cost for Saving Grace?
Can you get The Note as Chunin? ( only case where Hollow Leg might be needed, since MOME page here says it takes 70 appetite )
Was the name changed from Note Rush to Bingo Rush? I thought I saw that on the front page once, but didn't see it in the news archive.
Wasn't mentioned on the Bloodline page in the Tote's section, but do you get +30 stamina for a successful bingo with the Tote?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Yes you can get Anon without Hyuk.

javascript:;
quote[QUOTE=sniper11709,May 2 2008, 05:35 PM]Okay i had a choice of getting rid of Anon or Right.

I decided to get rid of Anon so here's the mission.

Part 1
[QUOTE]Genjutsu

Free Cookies?!

"Hey, Anon, if you sign your name on this here Not- er, FREE COOKIE PAPER, you'll get free cookies!" Trick him!

Difficulty: 19 Successes: 15 [/QUOTE]
Part 2
[QUOTE]"Wow, who would've thought that worked?" Hyuk gives you an eye. "Tell ya what. You go and Bingo - really Bingo, so it counts - the person I'm thinking of, and I'll make ya another offer. Here's a hint: They are one of the Top 10 Season 2+ Players the day you started this mission. Maybe they're in a rival village. Maybe they ain't. Maybe they're not even IN a village, and ya gotta coax 'em to join one. If ya get 'em right, you'll get a message tellin' ya what to do. Otherwise, you can just come back here and say "Let's Try Again", and you can come on back around for another name. Okay?"
[/QUOTE]

Part 3
[QUOTE]Hyuk looks at you. "Whoa. Hard core. I guess I can give you something magical to carry The Note around in - The Tote. more Stamina for Bingo'ing, plus I'm sure the thre- er, make that TWO buddies ya got left'll get a little snazzier. Tell ya what - you give me 10 more of your Daily Stamina (so now ya get 10 less stamina a day), and I'll trade ya a Tote. Last you forever, it will."

(Note: this is a PERMANENT trade: 10 of your daily Stamina for a Tote of your own. If you don't want to, leave and Abandon the mission, but honestly, who would do that?) [/QUOTE]
Part 4
[QUOTE]Hyuk tosses you the SPARKLIEST BAG IN THE WORLD. It has unicorns, and fuzzies, and who knows what else, plus, you think it is playing pop music. "It's all the rage where I'm from, A-hyuk!"

You've gotten The Tote!

Right and Lisa think it is pretty cool, too, and promise to help you out more. "Just as soon as we take out the trash," they say, and kick a strangely lumpy, heavy trash bag..

Right and Lisa are now Level 2!
You have lost Anonymous!

And, as usual, you feel some of your stamina slipping away[/QUOTE]

i didn't paste the Mr Burns impression because i couldn't care less.[/QUOTE]

quoted text

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
A reliable source says you don't need Hyuk to get Anon. just need the trade and to be bingo'd with a note page.

edit:
I am going to try it out soon. I will edit the guide if it turns out right. (100% sure it will but trying anyway so I can say I did it personally)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Tools of the Trade requires a village upgrade. It's been around a while.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: is the ''protect yourself from note pages for 24 hours with ryos'' thing is new because I reached the trade lvl 1 and I never heard of that before

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The Trade lvl 1 skill to see people who are not bingoed per village now takes 2 Juicy Apples to use

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I hope you don't mind Facepalm, it was really the best information I could find for most of it. I wanted to attribute your guide as the primary source of inspiration, even though I did paraphrase most of it.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Hey, that's my guide! ^-^ Well I run the Mokona Village Forum, and am trying to work out the details myself. I will update you when I get more about it! Glad to see our little forum is starting to get some recognition!

Facepalm of Mokona!

item.title: Disclaimer
item.content:encoded:
One of the most common criticisms about this Wiki that I hear is that it doesn't have enough info on the Trade. So, I know the site needed a guide, so this is what I came up with. However, I want to be perfectly clearâ€¦

I have not done this mission line yet. I cannot verify this information is true, so please be cautious!

The guide was put together with the help of a post from Mokona Village forums (available: here) for making the Trade 1 and 2. For the Trade 3, I've pieced together what I could from a post in Random Village's forums (here).

Please, please, please feel free to correct any information that's not correct. This is the best guide I could put together with what I currently have available, and by no means do I believe it's perfect!
